statement.tex: \text{Let $A=\{1, 2, 3, ... 9\}$ and $R$ be the relation in} \\ A\times A\text{ defined by}\left(a, b\right) R \left(c, d\right) \text{ if }a+d=b+c \\ \text{for $(a, b), (c, d)$ in $A\times A$. Prove that $R$ is an} \\ \text{equivalence relation. } \\ \text{Also obtain the equivalence class $[(2, 5)]$.}

step.context: \text{For R to be an equivalence relation, what three} \\ \text{attributes must it have?}
step.reason: \text{An equivalence relation must be demonstrably} \\ \textbf{Reflexive, Symmetric}\text{ and{\bf Transitive}}. \\ \text{In brief:} \\ \begin{tabular}{|c|c|} \hline \text{Reflexive} & (x,x)\in R \\ \hline \text{Symmetric} & (x, y), (y, x)\in R \\ \hline \text{Transitive} & (x, y), (y, z), (x, z)\in R \\ \hline \end{tabular}

step.context: \text{To prove R is Reflexive, for an arbitrary} \\ \text{element }(a,b)\in A\times A, \text{we need to show what?}

step.reason: \text{For Symmetry, we need to show} \\ \begin{array}{c} \left(a, b\right) R \left(c, d\right) \implies \left(c, d\right)R \left(a, b\right) \end{array} \\ \text{Applying the relation,} \\ \begin{align} \left(a, b\right) R \left(c, d\right) &\implies a+d=b+c \\ &\implies d+a=c+b \\ &\implies {\bf c+b=d+a} \\ &\implies \left(c, d\right)R \left(a, b\right) \end{align}

step.context: \text{To prove R is Transitive, for }(a,b), (c,d), (e, f) \\ \in A\times A, \text{ where} \left(a,b\right)R \left(c,d\right) \text{ and }\left(c,d\right)R \left(e,f\right) \\ \text{we need to show what?}
step.reason: \text{For Transitivity, we need to show} \\ \left(a, b\right) R \left(c, d\right), \left(c, d\right) R \left(e, f\right) \implies \left(a, b\right) R \left(e, f\right). \\ \text{Applying the relation,} \\ \begin{align} \left(a, b\right) R \left(c, d\right) &\implies a+d=b+c \\ \left(c, d\right) R \left(e, f\right) &\implies c+f=d+e \\ \end{align} \\ \text{Adding the two equations,} \\ \begin{align} &a+d+c+f=b+c+d+e \\ \implies& a+f+\underbrace{d+c}=b+e+c+d \\ \implies& a+f+\overbrace{c+d}=b+e+c+d \\ \implies& {\bf a+f=b+e} \\ \implies& \left(a, b\right)R \left(e, f\right) \end{align}

step.context: \text{If $(a,b)$ was in the equivalence class of $[(2, 5)]$} \\ \text{where } (a,b)\in A\times A \text{what could we say about} \\ a \text{ and } b?

step.reason: \text{We need $\left(a,b\right)$ from }A=\{1, 2, 3, ... 9\}, \\ \text{such that }a+5=b+2 \implies b-a=3 \\ \text{The pairs that satisfy this condition are} \\ \left(1, 4\right), \left(2, 5\right), \left(3, 6\right), \left(4, 7\right), \left(5, 8\right), \left(6, 9\right)
